definitions.name: play_dtmf
definitions.description:
Send DTMF tones to the current call.Use this function when:- You need to navigate an IVR menu system
- You need to send numeric input during a call
- Testing or troubleshooting DTMF tone recognition
- The customer asks you to press a specific button or enter a code.

This function will send the specified DTMF tones (touch-tone sounds) to the current call.
If no specific digits are provided, a random digit will be sent.

call_sid.description: The Twilio Call SID to send DTMF tones to

dtmf_digits.description: DTMF digits to send (0-9, *, #). If not provided, a random digit will be sent.

definitions.name: hangup_call
definitions.description:
Terminate the current Twilio call.
        
        Use this function when:
        - The conversation has reached a natural conclusion and you are saying goodbye
        - The customer explicitly asks to end the call
        - All customer needs have been addressed and the call should be terminated
   You decide the call is finished. 
 if the customer asks for the call to be hung_up, cancelled, closed, terminated or any other similiar term, then you should call this function.
